sen.j: 奈良文化財研究所（ならぶんかざいけんきゅうしょ）は独立行政法人国立文化財機構の一部門。
sen.e: Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties is a department of National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.

sen.j: 古都奈良の文化財、埋蔵文化財の研究や平城京、藤原京の発掘調査も手がける。
sen.e: The institute conducts research of (buried) cultural property in an ancient capital, Nara as well as excavation research of Heijo-kyo and Fujiwara-kyo.

sen.j: 1952年に平城宮跡が特別史跡に指定されたことにともない、同年4月奈良市春日野町で奈良文化財研究所として発足した。
sen.e: Nara Research Institute for Cultural Properties was founded in Kasugano-cho, Nara City in April 1952, as Heijo-kyo Palace Site was designated as a special historic site in the same year.

sen.j: 1954年7月、奈良国立文化財研究所と改称。
sen.e: In July 1954, the institute was renamed as the Nara National Cultural Properties Research Institute.

sen.e: Cultural property of ancient capital, Nara, including Heijo Palace Site was registered as the world heritage of the United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organization in 1998.

sen.e: In April 2001, the institute was integrated with Tokyo National Research Institute for Cultural Properties, granted the status of Independent Administrative Institution National Research Institute for Cultural Properties, thus became Nara National Research Institute for Cultural Properties.
